holidays.name: Learn Your Name in Morse Code Day
holidays.description: A day to tap into the fun of Morse code by learning to spell your name using dots and dashes.
holidays.origin: Celebrated unofficially on January 11 to encourage curiosity and learning about this historic communication method.
holidays.funFact: Samuel Morse originally developed Morse code in the 1830s to improve long-distance communication, and it was widely used in maritime and military signaling for over a century!

holidays.name: Step in a Puddle and Splash Your Friend Day
holidays.description: A playful excuse to jump into puddles and splatter some water on your unsuspecting pals‚Äîgood-natured mischief at its best!
holidays.origin: An unofficial, whimsical holiday born from childhood nostalgia and spontaneous puddle-jumping fun during rainy days.
holidays.funFact: Splashing friends in puddles traces back to childhood play worldwide, but no one knows who officially coined the holiday!

holidays.name: Hot Tea Month (Mid-January Focus)
holidays.description: While January is Hot Tea Month generally, January 11 is often cited as the day to savor a perfect cup and experiment with different brews to beat the winter blues.
holidays.origin: An unofficial observance aimed at promoting tea drinking for comfort, health benefits, and cozy moments during winter.
holidays.funFact: Tea is the second most consumed beverage in the world after water, and January‚Äôs chilly weather makes it the perfect reminder to enjoy it hot!

holidays.name: Winnie the Pooh Day
holidays.description: Celebrating the beloved honey-loving bear created by A.A. Milne, whose fictional birthday is January 18, but fans often start the week on January 11 with stories, movies, and honey treats.
holidays.origin: Fans and literary communities honor Winnie the Pooh in January as a tribute to his creation and cultural impact.
holidays.funFact: Winnie the Pooh was inspired by a real teddy bear owned by author A.A. Milne‚Äôs son, Christopher Robin, who also lent his name to a character in the stories.
